cab.content:
(This Telegram is the property of His Britannic Majesty's Government and should be returned to the Offices of the War Cabinet for transmission to the Colonial Office when done with unless required for official use.) G.T. 6404
Telegram
The High Commissioner of the Western Pacific to the Secretary of State for the Colonies.
(Received, Colonial Office 26th November, 1918).
With reference to my telegram 1st November. Following telegram has been received from Administrator, Nauru. Telegram Begins: Chief spontaneously requests me to inform you does not wish to be subject to rule of any self-governing dominion but remain with Colonial Office. Indentured labourers Caroline Island, Marshal Islands earnestly hope both countries will be protected by British Government, telegram Ends. RODWELL
RODWELL.
